titleInfo.title: Letter from John MacLeod, Resident in the Persian Gulf, to Major Henry Willock, in Charge of the British Mission, Tabriz

mods.abstract: The letter notifies Willock that the tomb erected by Captain William Bruce over the remains of Mr Rich and Dr Taylor in the garden of Jehan Nooma [Bāgh-i Jahān Nūmā] at Shiraz has been destroyed and speculates that this was done with the knowledge or at the order of the Government of Fars. MacLeod explains that he has learned details of the state of the tomb from Captain Martin of the Bengal Establishment, who is in Bushere [Bushire] en route to India. Some sources told Martin that it had been damaged by the weather, while another says that it was destroyed deliberately and that Hossein Ali Meerza [Ḥusayn ‘Alī Mīrzā] was heard publicly expressing his disapproval of the nature of the monument. Another, unnamed, source explained to MacLeod that the tomb was constructed to withstand the weather and that, soon after its construction, the garden in which it stands had been closed to Europeans. He states that he has reported the occurrence to Government.
